meanings.sent1: My pet fish will die if I forget to feed it.
meanings.sent2: People die when their bodies stop working.
meanings.sent3: I told my plant not to die on me, but it did anyway.
meanings.sent4: The fire's flames slowly die out as the wood turns to ash.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wish was to die peacefully in his sleep.

meanings.definition: A small cube with numbers or symbols on each side, used in games of chance
meanings.sent1: Roll the die and see what number comes up.
meanings.sent2: In board games, players often use a die to determine their moves.
meanings.sent3: The colorful die bounced off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The outcome of the game depended on the roll of the die.
meanings.sent5: The casino dealer handed out the die for the next round of the game.

meanings.definition: A tool used for shaping or cutting material
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a die to create precise cuts in the wood.
meanings.sent2: A metal die is essential for making consistent shapes in manufacturing.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor's favorite die was perfect for sculpting intricate details.
meanings.sent4: The tailor selected the appropriate die to cut the fabric for the dress.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler carefully chose a die to shape the silver into a beautiful pendant.

meanings.definition: To become less intense or fade away
meanings.sent1: The music will slowly die down as the party comes to an end.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the wind will die away, and the sky will clear.
meanings.sent3: The laughter from the comedy show began to die off as the audience left.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement started to die out as she realized the truth.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset will die out, leaving behind a dark sky.
